comments: He rocks!
Mr. Kevin Powers was a sub once for Jay Miller\'s class. I learned more from Kevin then I ever did Jay. Fantastic teacher!!

Very organized and answers emails. Online class and also took the math class with him. Good job just keep up with the assignments and do not get behind. Nice person and is helpful if needed. Got A in both classes.

Kevin is a wonderful instructor. I took welding at Palomar during the summer session at night. Being a female I was a bit worried about how I would be treated/not taken seriously. My goal was to learn welding basics in order to expand my sculpting skills. Although I had to rethink my original plans, I came away with the ability to do basic welding.

Super cool guy, knows welding and understands what he is teaching. Lectures are useful, gives notes outlined in power point. Quizzes are easy and open note/book final. Is always willing to help students and do one on one demos. Would definately take him again.

I love her. Very fun-loving, incredibly smart, and caring. Papers are challenging, but in a very good way, and she WILL help you with it if you are struggling at all. (Forces you to go to see her to pick up your papers.) Easy to talk to. Best writing teacher and best teacher I\'ve ever had at UCSB. I highly recommend her for Writing 2.

She is an absolutely amazing teacher! I loved every thing about her class, although sometimes the papers were a little frustrating due to their complicated nature. Her office hours are extremely helpful though and she is extremely accommodating for meeting times outside of class. If you tell her what\'s up, she will find a way to help you.

Not only was she extremely open and helpful throughout the quarter, willing to answer any questions, but she is the nicest person and very relatable. The writing class wasn\'t too hard, just follow all instructions she provides and ask ANY questions you ever have. Great teacher, she will be missed next quarter! Make sure to get her as your teacher.
easy class. The lectures were extremely unorganized which was annoying. Good for GE\'s.

I took this class just for GEs but what I got out of it was so much more. I learned SO much. Maureen is an AMAZING professor who truly cares for her students. She really wants you to do well & is always available outside of class. She\'s super funny too. Too bad she isn\'t teaching Mus15 anymore b/c I would\'ve recommend it to everyone!

AWESOME!!! Love her. Too bad I\'m a senior and can\'t still be a music minor, cause she definitely made me want to be. Vincent was hysterical, tough grader though. She\'s teaching Writing 2 next Fall and I HIGHLY recommend her!

Maureen is very sweet and enthusiastic. She loves what she is doing and will go out of her way to help everyone. It helps to go to lecture... I never used the book. Not once, it is useless, but you do need the CDs for the class. As long as you study before the test and practice for the listening portion you will score an easy A.

Really easy class. Tests are a joke, but you still need to study the material to do well. Whether you get an A or a B really depends on your TA, which I didn\'t think was very fair, but that\'s life. Concert reports are annoying but easy. Maureen is a very nice lady. Unfortunately she is no longer teaching Mus15 after this quarter :(

Maureen is one of the best professors ive had at UCSB. Shes a great lecturer and loves meeting her students in office hours. Pretty easy if you\'re willing to put a bit of time in. Sasha is a great TA too. 3 short papers and a few section assignments. Required to attend 2 concerts. overall, great class!

She\'s def a good prof, makes the notes clear and helps u remember the musical devices. As a music minor, it wasn\'t hard for me, even for those taking it to fulfill their Arts req its pretty easy. Fulfills writing req broken up into 3 short papers which rly helps. Vincent isn\'t that bad of a TA, if u go to office hrs he rly helps u on the paper.
Super nice and very approachable. Thought class was very interesting and Maureen has a way of keeping students involved in lectures. good class to take

Maureen is definitely one of the most upbeat professors i\'ve had so far. Would be an easy class if I didn\'t have Vincent as my TA...he grades unfairly on papers and all other TA\'s give out A\'s like there\'s no tomorrow. Other than that, it\'s a fun class with information i\'m never going to use outside class but It\'s a good unit and GE filler.

Very nice lady, fun lectures, a relief going to this class. Just don\'t say you heard the first piece of your concert when you really showed up ten minutes late and made up the fact that they tuned before. She\'ll report you to the Office of Judicial Affairs and give you a Zero. Shoot. Other than that, easy A, fun class.

This class is pretty easy and Maureen is very nice. She tends to treat the class like kindergartners, but that\'s not really a bad thing. There are 3 papers but they\'re really not very hard. Go to lecture because the tests are all on her lectures, not the book. If you are struggling, the TAs and Maureen are all very helpful!I recommend the class

Maureen is definitely a breath of fresh air. This is her first quarter teaching and like how she tries hard to make connections with the course material and the students. She can be a little scatter-brained, but what Music Professor isn\'t? She\'s great and I\'d recommend the class to anyone.

Lindsey is the type of teacher that will help and assist you so long as you reach out to him. His class is well-organized and he is always prepared for any questions/concerns. He adds humor to the classroom, which is a bonus to creating a fun environment. In terms of his workload, to put it simply: read, research, write, and repeat.

Lindsey is an extremely friendly and well-organized teacher. He is very understanding and loves to help you out if you are feeling lost. However, this doesn\'t mean you can slack off. Lots of writing assignments but clear expectations. Great teacher and inspirational man :)

Lindsey Wilkinson is a great teacher. He tries his best to help his students succeed in class. If you read all the assigned readings on time, you\'ll get an easy A. However, prepare yourself for group projects. I got an A- because my group couldn\'t collaborate well and were lazy in completing their assigned work.

There were many assignments to do throughout the course, but as long as you read the material than it is fairly easy. She had great lectures for an online class, and the readings were very scholarly and fun to read. I recommend if you don\'t mind somewhat of a heavy workload.

2 tests, 2 response papers. 2 extra credits opportunity. tests are same as study guides. in class assignments; goes over the class assignments before having students turning it in. don\'t buy the books; waste of $$. i never touched it. they only want you to read to have in class discussions but i don\'t participate.

Tough class, first of all she is very unclear on assignments and due dates. Her tests are confusing and review sheets are even more so confusing. I was lost the whole term and when I met up with her she just mumbled and didn\'t really help me understand. She seemed very uncomfortable the whole term and like she just wanted to leave.

Lindsey is a wonderful prof. Contrary to most reviewers Lindsy is a guy, by the way. He offered about 20 points of extra credit to our class, so that was awesome. He has very clear guidelines and expectations for class assignments and even posted some examples. Exams should be studied for, but aren\'t too difficult. Would take his class again.

I loved Lindsey\'s class & her as a teacher. She kept it interesting & entertaining & genuinely seemed to care about her students. She is very straight forward with her expectations & extremely helpful. I cannot talk her up enough. It was an easy A, but I found myself absorbing more info than usual because of her knack for relevant topic selection.

I really enjoyed this class because of the content and the discussions that went on in class. Our response papers were basically up to us to give our opinions. The guidelines and assignments for this course were pretty unclear, and sometimes the professor tended to mumble and talk too fast, but other than that I really enjoyed the class.
Pretty good teacher. Allowed a note card for the test. Explained topics well with interesting media (like video clips and stuff) to help illustrate points.
This is the easiest class I have taken at PSU. She is really funny and makes class enjoyable. The study guide were the exact questions for the tests and we went over it in class. Take her class!

I liked this class. Lindsey is quite knowledgeable and friendly. 2 multiple choice exams, 6 in class assignments, 2 short response papers. Lectures are a little boring sometimes because they are straight power point from the text. Tests are honestly a little too easy for my liking. Overall though, I enjoyed it and learned a good deal.

Interesting course, interesting professor. Honestly, if you printed out the powerpoints, you didn\'t need to do the course reading because she went over it all in lecture. She\'s funny and intelligent. As some people mentioned, she does read off her slides, she also can answer any question that she\'s asked. Plenty of opportunity for extra credit.

This class was so easy! You just had to show up, listen, and you got an A. She assigns readings for every class, but you don\'t need to read them because she goes over them in class. Also, her class was always so funny and interesting! It was my favorite class this term! I definitely recommend her class!

Interesting class. Professor is informative & clear but keeps it fun. Posts all lectures on D2L. Utilizes the textbook, other readings, films, & online articles. Attendance not mandatory & it\'s hard not to do well in this class. I recommend it.

I loved the class! Her powerpoints are very straightforward and her expectations are as well. Personable lecturer and her assignments are pretty easy. Reading for most classes but she goes over them in detail during class so I haven\'t done much of it at all and got a 96% on the midterm. Overall great!

For people to say that she is unclear about what she wants is crazy, she is super clear about what she wants. She drives home all of the things she expects you to know in class. She is felxible about many things, you just have to talk to her, and yes she does respond to emails. She may mumble from time to time, but I would definitely recommend her
I like the professor. She is very knowledgeable, nice and has a sense of humor. I would recommend her.

It is difficult to not get an A+ in this course. Super-easy and the professor is really nice. There were four different books which altogether cost me $60, I quit reading them after week three. You do need them for the last assignment though, which is easy. Easy to get points as long as you show up to class from time to time.

I took Marriage & Intimacy, a sociology class for the family studies cluster. This class was really easy as long as you did the work and paid attention. Reading every assigned passage in the textbook isn\'t really necessary as long as you get a basic idea. Her exams are easy. She has a good sense of humor, too.

i\'m very interested in the subject, but i feel like he was a bit boring. I dropped the class due to personal problems, but i don\'t believe i would take one of his classes again. if you\'re looking to take a psy class i recommend Kevin Burns if he\'s available.

I disagree with prior comments.I carry 22 hrs and managed an A on 1st test. It is ridiculous to post neg comments on prof after 4 weeks. All lecture outlines are available on pwr pt; he answers all e-mails promptly; he curved 1st test very student friendly. What more do you want? Dr. McDade is composed & considerate. Good class & an even better man
I WILL NEVER TAKE ANOTHER PSYCHOLOGY CLASS IN MY LIFE THANKS TO THIS GUY!...NEVER!

My best friend attended class with me the first two classes and dropped the class here to take at UA she loves it there.I wish I had joined her Its just the 4th week of class and I\'ve never seen so many people drop a class so quick

My friend came to the first two classes and she dropped the class. Her quote was "this guy is going to make this class hell" she was right. I wish I had only listened its been only 4 weeks and I\'ve never seen so many people drop a class so soon

My friend came to the first two classes and she dropped the class. Her quote was "this guy is going to make this class hell" she was right. I wish I had only listened its been only 4 weeks and more people have dropped than I\'ve ever seen this early

Take class at Harvard or Yale it will be much easier. Tests are insane and unfair. Tough material w/o much help. no test review/no study guide/no xtra credit/quiz offered as punishment. Anyone this boring should be more helpful. Went into class loving psych with A\'s in 3 prev Psy classes; He\'s almost succeeded in ruining psy for me.

WARNING!Ridiculously hard prof holds you accountable for entire book including what he never talks about + online summary + Obscure lecture points..refuses to offer study guide or reveiew for test..enjoys keeping you in the dark. Test ? worded very poorly..If you value your gpa and career stay away from this guy...you have been forewarned

Very old school teacher who feels the harder he makes class the better teacher he is. Very evasive when asked what his tests are going to be about. We just finished our first test...questions worded confusing hard..class average very low did grade on a curve w/o it nearly everyone fails..I just dropped the class today

Dr. Maurantonio is brilliant and nice to talk to. She is encouraging of student work and encourages us to get out into the great Richmond community for research and experience. Very active in working for students of disadvantaged backgrounds.

She\'s nice and approachable, but also knows her stuff. The readings, screenings, and paper topics are interesting and good for both RHCS-majors and gen electives. Class is heavily discussion based, with her serving as a moderator/agenda setter, which occasionally gets repetitive. Not hard to succeed, but put in the work and you will learn as well.

Had her for FYS Cops, Crime, and Popular Culture. It was a very interesting class. She is somewhat of a tough grader, but she provides great feedback and always welcomes you to her office. She gives 11 reading quizzes, but you are allowed to drop your lowest grade. There are no tests in the class and the longest paper is 4-5 pages.

I had her for the FYS Cops, Crime, and Popular culture, and she is an amazing woman and teacher! Somewhat of a difficult grader, because she is in communication studies, but she is fair and gives every student and entire page full of critiques. She lets you rewrite papers as well. She is awesome and so interesting!! Hope i can take her again.
I had her for my FYS, and I have to say, it was awesome! She was fun and energetic, and it was a very easy A. I would definitely take a class with her again.

This class is definitely not the easy A it used to be. She revamped her course and now just arbitrarily gives out grades. The discussions are very circuitous and boring...difficult to stay awake. Pop quizzes once a week, one paper, blog posts throughout the semester, a midterm, and a cumulative final.
A little bit frustrating. Asks discussion questions in class and instead of giving a response says "yeah, no, yeah, totally, definitely" Never fails. Pretty easy though, lectures can get boring.

Okay class, pretty easy. She\'s a nice person and seems to want everyone to do well. THe material is boring as ****, but she manages to liven it up w random youtube clips and whatnot. Sometimes her test questions were VERY ambiguous/not well phrased, which def cost people in my class points. Overall pretty decent teacher.

Um, I have no idea what that last guy was talking about, but I was in that class and I think that I know who wrote it. Hilarious! He\'s SO wrong. Prof. Maurantonio is AWESOME. She\'s smart, she\'s funny, and she knows what she\'s talking about. Yes, she\'s young, but that\'s cool. Take her class!

Shouldn\'t be teaching. She\'s fresh out of grad school and at some times was completely overmatched by intelligent students who don\'t agree with her. Her tests were confusing and she often made mistakes on them. Also she\'s very liberal and if you aren\'t completely to the left, make sure to censor your opinions.

She is an amazing professor. She engages everyone in the class, making everyone feel as though their thoughts are valued and completely comfortable. She wants students to do well, so she is open to helping as much as needed. She also uses clips from SNL and the Daily Show.

Dr. Markle is a good instructor. It is the material that is difficult. It is helpful to read the chapters several times before exams. If you attend class discussions, he goes over the readings to make it easier to understand, and he reviews before the mid-term and final. He is willing to help students before and after class.

You MUST listen/read all online lectures and thoroughly read through the chapters in order to understand this class and pass the quizzes. The final was easy when given a practice final to review. Disappointed on my paper grade - if not interested in philosophy,looking for an easy A, or don\'t have much time, don\'t take this class.
her online class was pretty easy. very leanient on grading the hw. i recommend her!

If you work well on your own, this is the class for you. He isn\'t helpful, and it\'s all online. You have to figure it out for yourself basically. Tests weren\'t too hard, it was just alot of weekly homework and quizzes. I wouldn\'t recommend him to someone who needs a clear communicator.

Very unclear as to what he expects in class. Expect to get ZERO feedback when it comes to how you are doing in the class. Left students confused as to what was going on when tests were supposed to be taken and were never posted, postponed quizzes multiple times because they weren\'t put up on time. The final exam was ridiculous.

She is unclear as to what she expects until the final comes around. Then she throws you a curve ball and expects you to have a 600 word paper along with a multiple long answer essay final all due fri by 5pm. She was throw off by the holidays and couldn\'t keep up with grading or getting back to students. It took her over a week to return my emails..

She makes it very clear what you need to study for each quiz and practical. She\'s fair and friendly and comfortable to be around, enough to admit you don\'t know what you\'re doing or if you made a mistake in lab. I recommend her for General Biology Lab over the other instructors.
Super nice and friendly in lab and was always available to answer questions or review. Quizzes could be a bit hard, but she graded fairly. Learned a lot in that lab!

Lab instructor. She has tons of typos in her homework assignments which are graded ambiguously. Nice person though once you get to know her. Study on your own since she won\'t tell you what she\'s specifically looking for.

Stricted grader known to man. Don\'t even waste your time. If you want a really good professor that won\'t mark you off for having your shoes untied, go with Kristen Kimble. Much better professor and much less of a headache.
She is really amazing professor. She is very helpful and she\'s ecouraged you to be better. Her quiz style is very clear and challenged. If you study hard, then you will do fine.
She is an awesome professor. You would lucky to have her as your Lab professor. She is very helpful. Please take this course with her. You will be lucky if you do.
Well lets see...she says "ok?" very quickly and often after her sentences. It\'s a lab professor so not much to expect.

Took her online anthro300 class, it was very organized and predictable. Discussions were clear and there were a few short videos to watch a week and one Inquisitive, which could take a couple hours but is worth it since nothing else takes up too much time. Strongly recommend the online class if anthro isn\'t your major.

Took the 8-week hybrid course for this class, the work was tedious at times but if you do it then it is an easy A. Lots of quizzes but they aren\'t that difficult. Make sure you participate in the discussion boards!

The online class is great and easy. Every thing is clear and organized. Easy tests and discussions. However Prof Tyler does not respond to you which is frustrating especially when trying to get a hold of her. She also took a very long time grading. Although the class is an easy A, if you have an important question; don\'t expect her to respond.

I took Professor Tyler\'s 8 week hybrid. The class was graded entirely on the online work. and discussions every week. All of he answers to every quiz or online or in the book. If you keep up with the course work you will get an A. I highly recommend taking her!

I only had an A in this class because I contacted her through the phone; any other method and she doesn\'t responds. Her Grading is very tough, but if you hit gold and write about a topic she likes, she will give an A. The Tests were on questions on specific facts and one-liners in the book, so you need to read carefully. Call her if you want an A.

Do not take her online class!! She posts almost every assignment late and takes forever to grade anything. She is terrible at responding to people with questions! I would not recommend her. Other than that it\'s an easy online class. Just read the textbook.

It was easy if you follow the syllabus and watch the weekly class recordings. She gives you a template to follow each chapter and those questions are on the weekly quizzes. The best thing about her online class is that you are not forced to reply to other students weekly discussion posts. The only complaint is her lack of communication and grading.

I took Tyler\'s online Anthro 300 class, was not the best class. She had a sub for us for a whole month, took a long time grading assignments, and did not put a lot of effort into her online class. The quizzes did not correspond with the chapters, and test were very random. Maybe in class she is great but stay away from her online class.

I really love Professor Tyler! Very helpful, sweet, and very clear on her lectures. The tests and quizzes were very easy. I took her online class. I really enjoyed her online class and enjoyed watching her lectures. I\'m a DSPS student and she really took the time to make sure I understood the lectures. I recommend taking this teacher!!

Erica is a wonderful person. I liked her a lot and she is so funny. However, she doesn\'t respond to emails at all and was gone for about a month so it got a little harder for us since we had a sub who went off track a bit. Overall, her class was good. I recommend her, but just make sure you take the quizzes. Tests are timed quizzes are not.

Professor Tyler is a nice professor, very knowledgeable about Anthropology. I really learned a lot and enjoyed her class. However, she doesn\'t answer e-mails and she doesn\'t let students know when she doesn\'t show up. My class finished on February because i took the 8 first week class and until now 05/21/16, she did not post grades yet.

The schedule for the online class is slightly ahead of the hybrid. So you basically read your book and do your weekly quiz before you watch the iTV. Her iTV lectures really help you understand the material better. She is nice and attractive but she just doesn\'t respond to email or text. You have to go to her office hour and she helps!

I absolutely loved Erica! She was out for almost a month on leave so that was a bummer but he lectures are really fun and engaging. Her quizzes are easy, all online! I would highly recommend taking her!

I love this teacher! Very easy quizzes because it\'s from the power points and the book. I would take her class again and again. Cares a lot about her students. Offers extra credit. Very easy class. I would recommend taking this teacher! Responds emails very fast.

Not responsive to emails-I only emailed three times throughout semester; no responses. Issues with weekly quizzes not being posted (not a bad thing !) Watch her posted lecture videos and take notes. Exam questions are from the lecture/powerpoints. Quiz questions from the text. Quizzes/exams not timed. Offers extra credit. Easy, interesting class.

This was a hybrid class. Super easy weekly online quizzes that you can ace by using the textbook. Interesting lectures and hands on experiences with Archaeology. If you\'re looking for an easy A GE course, definitely take this class!

I took her online class. I meet her in person and she\'s really sweet. She really cares about DSP&S students. Very helpful and the tests and quizzes are really easy. Power points are helpful and so are the lectures. Also are the study guides. One of my very professors.
The easiest teacher ever and pretty nice! . Recommend to take her if you want an easy A.

Mrs. Tyler is by far my favorite professor I have ever taken at FLC. She made anthro very enjoyable and easy to understand. She prepares you very well for the tests just take note on the powerepoint all the test questions come from them. Shes pretty attractive which makes it easy to pay attention lol. She makes class fun, I highly recommend her.

Take notes from her lecture slides to answer the study guides she hands out. Test questions are from her study guides and quizzes. I didn\'t read the book. I did look up a few things in there but it\'s not necessary. She hands out quite a bit of extra credit. Lectures are pretty interesting and keeps you engaged. Do everything and you should get an A

Very specific grading. You have to follow the lab format to a T. No shortcuts for this class. I had him for orgo lab 1 & 2. One good thing about him is that he explains the entire lab procedure at the beginning of class. Honestly, he\'s not easy, but his grading is very clear. Just be aware this class will eat up 3-4 hours to write the prelab.
WORST LAB INSTRUCTOR EVER! i took de tzoya for orgo 2 lab and she was honestly the best! Elliot Katten should be fired!!

The amount of work you have to put in, to get a decent grade from this guy, for a one credit class, is unreal He doesn\'t help during the experiments, and then grades you on them Senseless Expects you to read minds, ex know when to stop asking questions because he is tired and agitated. How sad dept\'s hire these type of instrctrs smart but no help
he is the worst!! stay away!! no sympathy

i dont appreciate the fact that he doesnt care about the students work. he is very anal and he was the WORST lab teacher i had in my life. i wish i didnt give him the benefit of the doubt. guys i strongly urge you to avoid him
worst lab instructor ever.

I have never learned less in any class in College. He is seldom available to help in lab bc he is too busy eating or grading reports. He says that he wants you to learn on your own how to do the exp so he won\'t help you and then has the nerve to be strict on grading yields (he watches you weigh it). I learned zero and still got an A. He\'s a joke.

I dropped his lab right away as soon as I walked out of the first lab. He checks the notebook and even if you do a good job he has some negative comment about it. He has to watch you weighing your product and then he reweighs the product after you leave. He is too big of a headache for one credit.

More work than other lab professors. Do the lab reports, lab notebook as he tells you and you\'ll be fine. Study the lab textbook every week to prepare for pop quizes. I got an A, so its manageable. Nice guy who appreciates someone who offers to help him.
Prof. Katten is very a fair lab instructor. He doesn\'t give freebies but he really knows whats going on and is very helpful. So long as you show up and keep your notebook in order you\'ll do well.

This guy\'s deal is interesting. This was his first semester teaching so he had no idea what he was doing. Because he had no idea though, he was very lenient. I can\'t say he\'d be this lenient for other semesters. If not, then, because of his lack of comprehension and because of his disorganization, it would be very tough to do well in his class.

Goodness, where do i start? He gives his heart out to teaching, he sometimes has trouble himself but such an amazing sweet guy. I loved every second in his class, hes lenient and is pretty chilled out. Thank you so much Professor Katten LOVED YOUR CLASS !!

he is really horrible...it was the first time ever that I dropped a class!! He is a disaster and does\'t know anything about the labs. He makes you come prepared but never knows anything and always has to ask another professor for help.AVOID HIM IF YOU CAN!!!!!

i took this teacher at City tech and at first i wasn\'t feeling her, she\'s old and talks a bit slow.. but the class is really interesting, take good notes because she gives a few quizzes, but all multiple choice. her tests are 51 multiple choice questions and she gives three easy essays. Barely uses the textbook, i would take her again.
Very unclear. Gives hard exams. The class was super boring and filled with so much stuff to cover.
She was mad boring.

I took this professor for intro. to psych. and learned nothing. She creates a mess on the board, mixing all the terms and definitions and gives nothing in the exam related to what she teaches in the class. Her exams are very hard and long. I would suggest to only take her class if you are super intelligent

I ENJOYED BEING HER STUDENT. SHE GIVES YOU A SECOND CHANCE IF YOU MISSED A CLASS EXAM. THEY ARE ALL MULTIPLE CHOICE. I LIKED THE BOOK THAT WE USED IN CLASS. IT WAS REALLY HELPFUL. SHE REALLY EXPLAINS THINGS THOROUGHLY.

I took her class in begining and dropped. I would not recommend her and can\'t believe the college would still keep her on. She is very condescending almost to the point of belittlement. Very mean...She only teaches from book and very boring. If you want a good prof. take Dr. Marcus you will learn something from him. Her class is like being in Highs
If you are a student who really wants to learn something, do not take her, she is rude, and her teaching is terrible, just terrible. if you care to learn something, do not take her, no no no

I just started this semester, and today, I dropped her. She is disrespectful, she needs to grow up, she ignores anyone who she feels like she does not like. She asked in class for people to raise their hand than when people were raising their hand, she ignored people. She is terrible at teaching, dwells on useless info. Terrible teaching. If you wa

Cool prof at times! She gets a bit cranky if you don\'t get what she\'s trying to explain. Multiple choice test, homework assignments every week definitely not an easy A but the class is very interesting! Definitely need the book for the class!
Multiple choice tests, no term paper. I would take this proff again!
He\'s cool, very good teacher

This is one of the kindest and most knowledgeable professors I have had at BMCC. Every assignment she gave was neither unnecessary or without a good purpose. We learned in a very systematic and chronological order about human developmental psychology. In the end, I would take this professor over and over again as many times as I could.
she is a very easy going teacher, works completely from the book. tests are easy and hw assignments were pre-wriitten in the syllabus. i learned a lot, pay attention and participate and its an easy A
He is really cool. Interesting to listen to what he has to say. He gives you a review for the test and if you study it you will get an A no problem. Otherwise class is easy and he makes it enjoyable.
Good teacher, even greater singer. Musician at heart. She knows what she\'s talking about. I can\'t say you\'ll have much interest in the subject, but it\'s a nice class nonetheless.

Greta is an excellent scholar who is passionate about what she is teaching. She is a very capable educator. She is also a gifted singer, which gives her even more credibility. You will be enriched by her knowledge.. Study hard! She is a master in her field who will not play games with your head.

Great class!!! She is truly passionate about this field and it shows in her teaching. She is willing to help anyone who asks. During the summer session she gave review sheets that were almost identical to what was on the test. She is a friendly person but you must work for your grade. If you show maximum effort she will boost your grade in the en
No Comments

New Prof, knows her area, but directions for assignements some what un-clear but she trys to give you as much help when asked for. Doesn\'t let you leave a few mins early if you have a class back to back with hers.

Knowledgeable, but very opinionated. Has a tendency to shove things down your throat. She asked us to point out any mistakes on her power points. When I pointed out that American Barr Association does not have tow r\'s in Bar, she told me I was wrong. Okay!

Apparently some people have their own personal biases when it comes to certain subjects. The only "indoctrination" that exist in this Prof\'s class room is Sociological. If you enter a sociology class w/o an open mind you very well may be offended.

If you ask her legitimate questions, you will get legitimate answers. She is very passionate about what she does for a living. And although she may be strict, she is an excellent teacher. Remember: you\'re in COLLEGE, you\'re not in high school anymore. She expects you to take responsibility and follow directions CAREFULLY. Take her class... trust me

I have taken four classes with this professor. If you dont mess around in class and ACTUALLY pay attention, you will have no problems with her. I never even bought a text book and made an A in every class I took. If you follow do the study guides and study them for the exam, you will do perfectly fine. If you ask questions, you\'ll get answers.

Ms. Geoffroy (who is now Mrs. Baker) is by far the one of the best professors I have ever had. I can see how some may think she is rude, however those people who tear her a new one on here are probably the ones who failed. She is friendly, helpful, and has made a big impact on my career. I HIGHLY recommend her as a professor. She is fantastic!
Worst teacher I\'ve had at Cape Fear thus far. Not helpful and although she says to voice your opinion get\'s pi**ed when you do and she doesn\'t agree.

Ms. Suzanne Geoffroy is now Ms. Suzanne Baker since she recently got married. She can be kind of rude. Very strict on cellphones.....as she should be since some are disrespectful with them in class. My main complaint is that you only have 3 tests and a project to make your grade. Tests are OK. You can use your book for the test.

She is very rude. If you answer a question that she asks you better have the exact one she has in her head or she will tear you down in front of the whole class. The tests are crazy if you don\'t read the text book and rely on her power points alone you will fail. You are not required to bring your text book, but I recommend it. Did I say RUDE!!!

All I can say is I wish I would have to come to this website first! What everyone is saying about her is absolutley true! DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS! She is very rude! I cant believe how picky she is on papers, more so than any English/Lit teacher I have ever had.. I dropped this class!
Excellent teacher! Very organized and interesting. She is willing to help if you go to her. Just don\'t be an a**, and you will do great.
Very one dimensional. Not easy to get along with.

What an awesome teacher. I have just finished my online class with her, and I found it to be very educational and entertaining. If you just put a bit of effort into the material, you will leave with a deserving grade. I would be excited to have another class with her.

It states in the rubric for online classes to email your instructor with any questions you have, don\'t even bother emailing her. All she will tell you is to refer to the class documents-not helpful AT ALL. She always says what you\'re doing wrong in assignments but doesn\'t provide ways to improve your faults. Kinda rude too.

Rude! Grades on pet peeves and not how much you have learned about Sociology. Threatened to give me a zero for for being one line short on a one-page paper! Not helpful when I went to her to ask how I could improve, twice! Emails are extremely harsh and condescending! I went to the dept head for help, he has no backbone and refused to get involve

She is a great teacher and i loved the class! She begins the semester with a hard shell but is actually much more lenient than she appears. She does NOT stand for asking for leniency infront of other students, but will infact give it if you go to her office. For tests she gives study guides and powerpoints and her exams are very easy!!

Not very helpful and kind of rude. She allowed students to come in late all the time, which was distracting. However, the one time I was late, she mentions the attendance policy with an attitude. Advice: if you take her class, be sure to READ the text book. Rely on your book, not the powerpoints.

Horrible teacher. Took an online class with her and it was rediculous! Everyone else in the class agreed. Her emails don\'t make sense, she is short-tempered and the one time I went to talk to her in person about my grade she was very rude and unhelpful! Didn\'t seem to want to help me when I asked for help mid-semester.

This is a Racial and Ethnics class, She can take anything and give a example on how it is **** to someone. Shes pretty one track minded and anything you say that contradicts her she will jump all over you
Only three tests makes it hard to earn a good grade. Class is listening to her talk about her powerpoints. Tests are easy if study, but there are some confusing questions. Very boring class.

Ugh. Disrespectful, rude, does not care about your opinion. If you don\'t agree with her, you\'re wrong, and she\'ll make you feel stupid. Lectures are boring, takes her ppt from other teachers. Easy class, but what a horrible teacher. Take with someone else or just stay away.

I do not like Joy. If you\'re her favorite, you can do no wrong. But for the rest of us, she dislikes us because we have different opinions than she does. I have felt uncomfortable sharing opinions in class because I know she will belittle me or say I\'m wrong. Her assignments are unclear, she took off points for not stapling "correctly." Not a fan.

She is the sweetest woman on the planet, so helpful and laid back. I definitely recommend taking her classes. There is some home work put it is all posted online in the begging of the semester and they are just simple worksheets, a little reading is required but most test questions are based off class discussion. She is very fun and easy going.
Good teacher. Tests aren\'t too tough, neither are quizzes on homework. A little boring at times, but overall not a bad teacher.

Loved her. Lots of interesting class discussions, adequate amount of work, easy and broad-topic projects so you can do what you do best. Be warned she is a bit of an intense person if you get on her bad side, but if she likes you, she loves you. Glad I took this class
She is not the best professor. There is a lot of self teaching involved and much book work. She tries to be entertaining yet she is boring.

I loved her. She is accommodating to her students. Clear and open for discussion. Yes she talks about the Somali Bantu a lot but that is a special field for her and it applies to what she is teaching. Can go of on tangents and isn\'t very computer savvy. One of the most honest and fair teachers I ever had.

Very knowledgeable, intelligent prof. VERY easy to get an A in this class. Some exam study guides, MC exams, loads of extra credit, easy homeworks, lots of movies all made for a smooth ride. Talks about the Bantu a lot because she studied them in the field - it\'s not a drawback, it\'s interesting. Overall, entertaining, fun and easy class.

The most uninteresting professor I have ever taken. This class is not an "easy A" by any means. She doesn\'t teach, its just read from the slides, but on that rare ocasion she does stray away from the presentation, its about her personal life....

Honors Intro to Anth. She knows her stuff but is not very sensitive to students\' level of engagement. Lectures can be very boring as she just talks on. Relies heavily on powerpoints posted on vista which further discourages me to pay attention in class. She\'s alright, but if you want to take this class try looking into other profs first.

Monotone and dull her lectures (which she actually takes from another teacher, she doesn\'t even make her own powerpoints) aren\'t the worst of it. She\'s hardly what I would call a real anthropologist. I took the honors section and she was HORRIBLE. Learned more by reading a chapter in the book than the whole semester of class. A true disappointment.

She\'s incredibly boring and repeats herself a lot. Easiest class ever, but a terrible teacher. Spends all her time telling us we should go back to the days when women stayed at home and were subservient to men; I spent my time on Facebook and still got an A.
I think she is crazy, and she obsesses over odd things, such as her very liberal/ socialist views (really, we don\'t care). Everything is powerpoint and easy, but she can barely run a computer.

Extremely easy A, but it is an intro. course. She goes on about the Somali Bantu a lot, but that\'s what she does outside of teaching. It feels like the class drones on and on--it\'s rather slow and un-challenging. Offers bonus work, fun to do, but unnecessary since the class is so easy.
Lectures on powerpoint. Tells you whats on the test. Easy class and interesting

Good class. Notes are all powerpoint. Offers extra credit. Easy quizzes. Tells you exactly what is on test so just go through your notes and study that and you should be fine. As long as you come to class and read the book if your confused, trust me you\'ll do fine! I definitely did not mind coming to this class at all, even though it was at 9:15am

so incredibly boring. rambles on about her relatives (esp. grandkids) way too much. i\'m already sick of hearing "the somali bantu" and we\'re 3 classes in. i feel bad for the grad. assistant, he seems cool. and he looks like zach galifianakis.

Dr. Cantor is an extremely lenient and understanding professor compared to others. He is a really sweet person, and he cares about his students. He drops a lot of low grades, and gives many extra credit opportunities. In my opinion, he isn\'t the best at explaining certain concepts, and lectures can be confusing, so definitely join a study group.
I loved the class. I loved him. It was a tough class but he tried his best to make it clear and fun. He was really helpful.
Very cooperative with the class and many opportunities to get a better grade. Not always the easiest material but he breaks it down very well.
I never knew economics could be so interesting. The course is not easy but the professor gives plenty of opportunities for extra credit. Great professor.
Cantor is a great professor with a great sense of humor.

The most confusing class that I ever took. The teachers mouth would move but the words will become mumble jumbo. He understood the topic while the class was confused and couldn\'t get a question in at all.

He is actually a much better teacher than I realized at first. I think he belongs in a lecture hall rather than a 10-20 student interactive class room. If you take all the notes, review them, do all the homework/handouts/quiz/ex cred and review. You will come to realize he was great. 18 months years later I still reference my ECON 102 notebook.

Cantor is very intelligent, but his teaching style is very confusing. He gets caught up on one concept for weeks, and has trouble clearly explaining everything else. He also tends to miss subtleties and nuances, so be straight forward and only use vocab from the book in class. He gives you a lot of opportunities to improve your grade.
An excellent instructor! Take this class if you want to learn some economics.
Worst professor ever, does not have respect for students, specially towards the female kind.

Great teacher! Kept the class interesting and gives students many ways to improve grades. Very interesting discussions and extra credit. Comparable teaching style to professors at competitive four year institutions. Explains a challenging subject very well, and makes concepts easy to grasp and applicalbe to every day life.
He freestyles microeconomics based on his previous experience.

Worst professor I\'ve ever had at NCC. Gets nervous when teaching class, stayed on one chapter for a good 6 weeks (Chapter 3) causing our class to fall way back, not enough knowledge in material...frankly I don\'t know how he was approved to teach...my suggestion: when you spot this name, RUN!

I\'m sure he understands all of the material himself, but he was not great at actually teaching the information. The class basically got stuck on one concept for the whole semester and really fell behind. Open note quiz once a week, and there was a take home final. He\'s a good guy, but hasn\'t quite figured out how to teach in a way that makes sense

Cathy is such a sweet lady, who genuinely wants women to learn how to defend themselves. She answers any questions you may have & is more than willing to practice moves step by step. You\'ll walk away feeling more confident and stronger in ways that you never thought possible. Take her class! You\'ll love it! Promise :)

Very fun class. You\'ll learn a lot; not just about defending yourself but feeling confident in yourself, too. Attendance is mandatory. A man will come in for the final to perform an attack on each student and you\'ll have to properly fight back. It\'s really easy. Such a great class!

womens self defense. you learn a lot. attendance is the only grade. you use the techniques you learned to defend yourself against a man for the final, but its a good experience and you can pass the class easily if you just come to class and try a bit. shes a great instructor and really nice and funny.

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: This instructor will work with you if you let him know what is going on. Assignments can be redone for a better grade.

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: Great teacher! Very easy class. I got a 97 without really trying. quizzes and tests are unlimited time. Please do yourself a favor and take her.

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: 12 Quizzes (10 Questions each), 2 Tests, 2 group projects, 11 Discussions, and a Final. REALLY easy and straight-forward class. Teacher responds quick and is helpful when needed. You don\'t really NEED the book but some questions do come strictly from it on tests and quizzes.

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: I took this course summer 13\' at GPC. This course was simply O.K. The material was somewhat interesting and the work was easy. I ended the semester with a 96, which is a 4.0 . I thought the teacher came off a little snobby when you tried to contact her about a problem but other than that, the course was good. Take if you want an easy A.

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: Outstanding teacher! Everything about the class was great. I took her class online and she is extremely helpful. Responds to emails quickly. Isn\'t strict about due dates and assignment submission. This class is easy to pass if you read and check your email.

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: She is an awesome teacher. I took her class online. She was very helpful. She responds to email quickly. If you read what is required, you should pass the quizzes. One of the best EDUC teachers at GPC.

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: Professor was quick to respond. Very easy class. I would def recommend this professor!

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: The class is a very easy class. It is very defined on what you have to do. When it comes to actually solving problems that is a completely different story. When conflict arises and you attempt to involve her nothing gets solved. The ppl who did nothing still get credit and she just basically tells you all to be "nice". Pray you get a good group.

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: Really liked this class and the professor; she made us think and comfortable to share our thoughts; I dread group projects and we had 2 but they turned out to be okay, got A\'s on both and I am an online student; definitely recommend this professor

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: ONLINE-Discussions are an easy 100 just follow instructions. Quizzes are fairly easy-always 1 trick question(go with gut). Loved the no time limit on quizzes or tests! All papers are group projects-blah! But made 100\'s on them! She\'s clear on assignments (emails info & planned slllabus)&always responds. Not hard to get an A if you make the effort.

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: Awesome teacher! I was nervous about taking this class in the summertime since it\'s a half term class so it\'s only a few weeks long. She definitely eliminated a lot of stuff for the summer so that you\'re not drowning in homework. A couple of discussions and quizzes a week, a test, a group project, and a final. Very easy online summer class!

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: I love this teacher. She was very clear on the assignments and discussion questions. I took this class on-line and it was the best route to take. I advise anyone to take her on-line.

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: Great teacher all around. Take her. You\'d be glad you did.

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: Great online class and teacher! She answers promptly, cares about your grade, and makes sure you get things done. Easy class, if you try!

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: great teacher

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: She was really nice and cared that students got there work in. She will keep sending messages saying hey this was due. But the class is not an easy A. There is a bunch of assignments that aren\'t hard it\'s the discussions she won\'t give 100 for

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: How does this woman have a doctorate? I have taken about 15 online classes; this is by far the most confusing I have ever taken. The discussions are easy. The group project and other assign. probably would be easy if she taught us how to do them!! She hardly responds, and when she does they are USELESS responses. Who knows what grade I will get?

school_name: Georgia State University Perimeter College - Decatur
comments: Loved the class. I would take it again. You have a time line when to turn in your work. Easy to keep up with. No test. One final that was so easy!!!

Travers Breen is a great man. I took his Weight Training class and it was so easy. All you have to do is show up and life weights. There are about two take home projects that are very easy. The final test is very easy also.
Nice teacher and is fairly easy. Just show up and participate.

Great guy who makes forced gym classes enjoyable. Only thing is don\'t be late, at least for cycling where we leave campus. You must be on time or we leave without you. Cares about his students and his class was enjoyable. I highly recommend.
Show up, write the 3/4 page paper every week and you will pass. He just wants to see effort being made.
As long as you know how to listen and take notes like an adult, this class is for you. Easy, laid back, and she knows her material well.

he was a really cool guy. i took both of my gyms with him which was backpacking and hiking. hiking was cool but a hard workout we hiked about 5 miles each hike, beautiful hidden gems of nature. backpacking was fun it was basically all lecture, 1 day hike and a weekend campout. it was really cold but i got close with the peoples in the class

Took him for backpacking my first semester and then hiking my second semester. Both classes were very enjoyable and I would DEFINITELY recommend both. The walks were bearable and fun. We built ourselves up for a 6 mile hike which was good. Class was 9-12. We would meet 930 and leave immediately and be done very early. A paragraph on each park req

Breen\'s a good professor. No complaints. He has students hand in one page papers on each hike and then one more paper about your favorite hike at the end, but other than that, show up (make sure to have a doctor\'s note if you miss a class), and you pass. He picks some very nice hikes and exposed us to parks we never knew about.

He was an awesome teacher I took him for beginning tennis and he was really able to teach you all of the basics. He would always look around to see if anyone needed help or if their form needed to be corrected. Overall really great teacher would totally recommend you only have one test over the rules at the very end.

Took him for a hiking class. Class was from 9:30-11, we\'d leave immediately at 9:30 for the hikes and be done way before 11, but he wouldn\'t wait for anyone who was even a little late so my two friends failed. Then on the last day he was half an hour late to the hike and we didn\'t get out till 12. He barely spoke to the class on the hikes.

Wanted to take a fun class so I took hiking. And it actually ended up being really fun. We went to a lot of Long Island parks, including Fire Island. We didn\'t really "learn" much, but it was extremely involved. We never hiked less than 2 miles and went up to 6 miles the last class. Some were more difficult, so be prepared.
He was very rude and did not respect his students. I would not take any more of his courses.

Took Fitness Walking as a summer course expecting to put no effort into the class. I was surprised and this class actually turned out to be great. Professor Breen makes it fun and it goes by really fast. The only written work was a class "journal" that recorded what we had done for the day. I would recommend taking it.
Easy class. had him for volleyball, we warmed up by practicing serves and bumps. I suck at volleyball but everyone in the class was patience at least.

Awesome guy. I took him for both rockclimbing and hiking. He\'s really laid back and easy to work with. I don\'t know why people are saying it was so hard to get an A, I got an A in both classes and am not a very physical person. He\'s also incredibly beautiful, so there\'s that.

Pretty funny guy and also really laid back. Backpacking was extremely simple, the written/oral presentations were easy, the day hikes were brief, and the overnight camp out/hike was fun. Wished there was more day hikes like the actual hiking class, but the camp out made up for it.

He is a nice guy, and has a laid back personality that made going to Tennis fun. But his final exam was much harder than expected, even though I studied for it thoroughly. Overall his class was fun, but it seems that getting an A in his class is difficult even if you attend each class.
So hot and he is so nice. He really motivates you to go to class and it is well worth it looking at him :)
This is Professor Cutie Pie!Had to drive alot to get to hiking trails. Worth it.
he\'s very fun and a great teacher!

One of my favorite classes and profs thus far. A great subject that is very relevant here in BC. Jean is very friendly, knowledgeable, and fair, with a tendency to go off on tangents, which can be interesting. Lots of guest lecturers, some better than others. There are two essays, and a final exam and the evaluation was flexible and more than fair.

Jean is the funniest and most random professor. He is so knowledgable about everything, especially forestry. Made a 3 hour forestry lecture almost enjoyable. Marks essays fairly and allows you to redo.

One of my favourite profs at Uvic. A very knowledgeable teacher who is approachable and available for help outside of class. He marks essays fair, and will let you redo if u aren\'t satisfied. He has real-life practical knowledge which helps.

A great prof. Brought into replace Dr. B. Penn (while she ran for the election). He\'s a silvaculturist by trade, not a professor, so his notes are simple. Though its a 3 hour lecture slot, every week had a new guest lecturer. Final exam questions were given, and easy. Very easy to negotiate with when you\'re not happy with a grade. A GPA booster.
